page.title: 04Langside Quarry - Kennoway
page.content: { Langside Quarry}is situated half a kilometre to the north of the village of Kennoway. The quarry has provided some employment since the beginning of this century. The original owner of the quarry was a man called{W.B.Miller}but it has recently been taken over by{Hewden {Stewart Contracts of Glasgow. The quarry is sited on what is believed to be a blowhole in a string of ancient volcanoes that ran through the Kingdom of Fife millions of years ago. The quarry produces around 150,000 tons of{Basalt rock}every year which is crushed to produce aggregate for road building throughout the country. The company plans to expand to produce further products, but unfortunately this does not mean more employment for the area.
